name: Asset
description: Asset is a device of the environment that supports information-related activities. Assets should be protected from illicit access, use, disclosure, alteration, destruction, and/or theft, resulting in loss to the organization.

name.description: The asset name, ordinarily as assigned by an administrator.

uid.name: Asset UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the asset.

type.name: Type
type.description: The asset type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

desc.name: Description
desc.description: The description of the device, ordinarily as reported by the operating system.

domain.name: Domain
domain.description: The network domain where the device resides. For example: work.example.com.

group.name: Group
group.description: The name of the group to which the device belongs. For example: <code>Windows Laptops<code/>.

labels.description: The list of labels attached to the asset.

owner_name.description: The user or department associated with the asset.

priority.description: The original priority assigned to the asset.

priority_id.description: The normalized priority identifier assigned to the asset. The priority is useful for calculating the urgency for alerts or incidents.

-1.name: Other
-1.description: The priority is not normalized. See the priority attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

provider.description: The source or the provider of the asset data.
